brief_summary.textblock:
This open label trial is conducted to investigate the efficacy and safety of allogeneic
      umbilical cord blood (UCB) therapy for patients with acquired brain injury.

clinical_study.brief_title: UCB Therapy in Acquired Brain Injury

detailed_description.textblock:
Acquired brain injury (ABI) means brain damage caused by events after birth, rather than as
      part of a genetic or congenital disorders. Those with ABI suffer from cognitive, physical,
      or behavioral impairments limiting their activity and participation in society. ABI results
      from traumatic or non-traumatic brain injury due to internal or external source (e.g.
      infection, brain tumor, hypoxia). Preclinical studies regarding cell therapy in animal
      models of ABI showed improvements of neurological dysfunction. UCB possess various stem or
      progenitor cells and is known to secrete neurotrophic factors to repair injured brain. This
      clinical research aims to determine the safety and efficacy of allogeneic UCB for patients
      with ABI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Acquired brain injury

          -  Duration: over 12 months

          -  Willing to comply with all study procedure

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Medical instability including pneumonia or renal function at enrollment

          -  Uncontrolled persistent epilepsy

          -  Poor cooperation of guardian,including inactive attitude for rehabilitation and
             visits for follow-up

          -  Not eligible according to the principal investigator

facility.name: CHA Bundang Medical Center, CHA University

clinical_study.official_title: Umbilical Cord Blood Therapy for Patients With Acquired Brain Injury

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: GMFM (Gross Motor Function Measure) as a standardized measurement tool for assessing Gross Motor Function consisting of sub-scales; lying & rolling, sitting, crawling & kneeling, standing, walking, running & jumping (range: 0~100 , Higher value means better gross motor function.)
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in standardized gross motor function

secondary_outcome.description: GMPM (Gross Motor Performance Measure) as a standardized measurement tool for assessing quality of movement regarding 3 properties of 5 ones; alignment, coordination, dissociated movement, stability, and weight shift (range: 0~100, Higher value means better motor quality.)
Korean version of Bayley Scale of Infant Development-II Mental Scales (Higher value means better cognitive function: raw score 0 - worst, 178 - best.)
Korean version of Bayley Scale of Infant Development-II Motor Scales (Higher value means better motor function: raw score 0 - worst, 112 - best)

Pediatric Evaluation of Disability Inventory (PEDI) for assessing functional performance in daily activities in children (All values are adjusted and higher value means better functional performance, 0 - worst, 100 - best.)
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in functional performance in daily activities
Changes in brain white matter integrity

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
